definition: To engage in a process of discussion and negotiation with the aim of reaching an agreement or settlement, typically involving multiple parties. This term is commonly used in various contexts, such as business transactions, diplomatic negotiations, legal proceedings, or resolving conflicts.

examples.german: Ich muss mit meinem Chef über mein Gehalt verhandeln.
examples.english: I have to negotiate my salary with my boss.

examples.german: Die beiden Parteien müssen über die Bedingungen des Vertrags verhandeln.
examples.english: The two parties have to negotiate the terms of the contract.

examples.german: Wir können über den Preis verhandeln, wenn Sie interessiert sind.
examples.english: We can negotiate the price if you are interested.

examples.german: Die Gewerkschaft verhandelt im Namen der Arbeiter.
examples.english: The union negotiates on behalf of the workers.

examples.german: Es ist wichtig, fair und respektvoll zu verhandeln.
examples.english: It is important to negotiate fairly and respectfully.
